sentences_texts: The manager continually interrupted with "Is there anything else I can do for you?", a strange comment because she had hardly listened, let alone responded to our expression of disappointment at our experience. aspect: manager
My party had the BBE $29 fixe prix menu, which was such a wonderful deal since it also came with a flight of sake! aspect: BBE $29 fixe prix menu
The have over 100 different beers to offer thier guest so that made my husband very happy and the food was delicious, if I must recommend a dish it must be the pumkin tortelini. aspect: food
I did not try the caviar but I tried their salmon and crab salad (they are all good) aspect: crab salad

The waitress was no where to be found at all throughout the course of the meal, did not refill a single drink nor did she bother to inquire about my satisfaction with the food or even bring the check at the conclusion of the meal. aspect: waitress
With the exception of our lemon salad that had so much pepper on it that our eyes started watering, the food here was decent, not great. aspect: lemon salad
There are no price listed in the menu, and she will not provid them with a smile. aspect: price
I had the Lamb special which was perfect. aspect: Lamb special
Try their chef's specials-- they are to die for. aspect: chef's specials

we all liked the brunch items we had but when we later asked if the chips were supposed to come with the meal, the waitress explained it away by saying sometimes they forget instead of apologizing and offering something extra. aspect: waitress
The hostess and the waitress were incredibly rude and did everything they could to rush us out. aspect: waitress

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: rolls
This place is the most Japanese it can ever get. aspect: place
We politely asked our server for the regular menu, but were told that for large parties they could only offer us the banquet menu (would have gone elsewhere had we known). aspect: server
When we asked a waiter for an explanation of the long wait with some many empty tables he had no answer so we asked for the manager. aspect: waiter

The Four Seasons has history and it is a sort of landmark of New York City restaurants, but trust me, they will charge you through the nose just so that you can say "I've been to the four seasons restaurant". aspect: The Four Seasons
It's a tiny place so if you get there before 8pm on a weekend (Thurs?Sun) you will find it easier to get a table or a seat at the sushi bar. aspect: place
It was the first place we ate on our first trip to New York, and it will be the last place we stop as we head out of town on our next trip to New York. aspect: place
They crumbed the table once, although it was soiled the entire meal. aspect: table
The atmosphere is nothing special, but it feels like a Sushi establishment in Tokyo. aspect: atmosphere

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: assorted sashimi

While the staff was kind and attentive, our waiter never once broke a smile, even when I told him it was my friend's birthday, although he did bring a dessert with a candle at the end of the meal. aspect: waiter
The food was pretty good, but due to our large size (~16) the manager asked us to limit our appetizers to just 3 selections b/c he didn't want to overburden his cooks. aspect: manager
I always listen to the waiters' recommendations, because they're always awesome - either a special or just one of their faves off the menu. aspect: waiters
I picked the Grilled Black Cod as my entree, which I absolutely devoured while someone commented that the Grilled Salmon dish was better. aspect: Grilled Black Cod
The Steak Tartare is a great bet, they fix it for you at the table. aspect: Steak Tartare
The lobster sandwich is $24 and although it was good it was not nearly enough to warrant that price. aspect: lobster sandwich
I choose to go with one of the special, the braised lamb shank in red wine, which was excellent. aspect: braised lamb shank in red wine
The cold appetizer dishes taste like the way I remember them to taste when I was growing up in Taiwan. aspect: cold appetizer dishes
As usual the omikase didn't disappoint in freshness, although it scored low on creativity and selection. aspect: omikase

I've also been amazed at all the new additions in the past few years: A new Jazz Bar, the most fantastic Dining Garden, the Best Thin Crust Pizzas, and now a Lasagna Menu which is to die for (these are not your average lasagnas)! aspect: Lasagna Menu

i think friends coffee shop makes great food the service is great and they are very poilte i think that they should open more because there the best food store i ever ate from the food is addicting and you cant stop eating because it so delious. aspect: coffee
The menu looked great, and the waiter was very nice, but when the food came, it was average. aspect: food
We, there were four of us, arrived at noon - the place was empty - and the staff acted like we were imposing on them and they were very rude. aspect: staff
We had Pam's special fried fish and it was amazing. aspect: Pam's special fried fish
Everyone that sat in the back outside agreed that it was the worst service we had ever received. aspect: service
the fish was fresh, though it was cut very thin. aspect: fish
The food is not what it once was (potions have seriously seen downsizing) prices have gone up, and the service is the worst I have experienced anywhere (including mainland Europe). aspect: food
THE SERVICE IS AMAZING, i've had different waiters and they were all nice, which is a rare thing in NYC. aspect: waiters
My boyfriend had the New England Chowder it was good but I think the award should go to the Lobster Bisque. aspect: New England Chowder
The space is grand with a very high ceiling although it is one of those places that they keep so dark you are not really sure what you are eating anyway. aspect: space
It may be a bit packed on weekends, but the vibe is good and it is the best French food you will find in the area. aspect: French food
The rice was poor quality and was cooked so badly it was hard. aspect: rice
Food wise, its ok but a bit pricey for what you get considering the restaurant isn't a fancy place. aspect: restaurant
We didn't want a bottle of bubbly on a weekday so we each got little bottles of Korbett it was just enough. aspect: bottles of Korbett
whoever the jazz duo was, they were on POINT. aspect: jazz duo
This was not the same hostess I usually see there who happens to be very sweet and provides excellent service. aspect: hostess

The trick to the tomato and onions is ask for it light on the onions, heavy on the tomatoes, order steak for one less person than you have in your party and if the steak is too rare, you can cook the individual pieces more by placing them on the platter around the edges. aspect: tomato and onions
We even had a visit from the Manager who wanted to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. aspect: Manager
The 9 oz steak came next and it tasted great, at least initially. aspect: 9 oz steak
Their bagels are fine, but they are a little overcooked, and not really a 'special' bagel experience. aspect: bagels
One of our diners didn't like her fish and both the waitress and the manager insisted on replacing it. aspect: fish
They have it all -- great price, food, and service. aspect: food
Planet Thailand has always been a hit with me , I go there usually for the sushi, which is great , the thai food is excellent too . aspect: sushi
For a restaurant with such a good reputation and that is usually so packed, there was no reason for such a lack of intelligent customer service. aspect: restaurant
service was attentive at the beginning but the waiter lost us towards the end and we had to flag them down for the check. aspect: waiter
The Black Duck is a great date place, whether going for dinner or just for a drink at their huge, antique-ish bar. aspect: Black Duck
I ordered the smoked salmon and roe appetizer and it was off flavor. aspect: smoked salmon and roe appetizer
Can’t believe how an expensive NYC restaurant can be so disrespectful to its clients. aspect: restaurant
Don't dine at Tamarind for the vegetarian dishes, they are simply not up to par with the non-veg selections. aspect: vegetarian dishes

The lunch got a little bizarre when we asked the waiter how the joint got it's name, and he made his hands into cups in reference to placing them on a woman's breasts and said, No, not this. aspect: waiter
The first time the sushi was outstanding, the second time it was a little bland. aspect: sushi
However when the party was complete we had the other waitress come over who said that we had to order all the food at once and couldnt order just appetizers. aspect: waitress
If you don't care about the wait staff as long as they bring you your drinks and dinner, then go to Opa. aspect: wait staff
Watch out for the overworked, stressed out waitress who dumps tapa dishes on the table and leaves w/out announcing what it is. aspect: dishes
This happened while many diners were enjoying their meal and it was rudes. aspect: diners

The presentation of Snooze is excellent and it is one of those places that you feel more sophisticated just for being there; but peel back the layers and you have an overpriced IHOP with a high brow menu. aspect: Snooze
Our waitress was a bit cold but she was still attentive and food came quickly. aspect: waitress
I'd recommend getting an appetizer b/c the dinner takes a bit to be cooked, but it was definitely worth the wait. aspect: dinner
Especially the manager or host who kept walking by and giving us the evil eye to see the progress of our dinner so they could turn the table over to other customers. aspect: manager
Anyway we get a table and order some appetizers from one of the waitresses who was pleasently nice. aspect: waitresses
The pancakes were certainly inventive but $8.50 for 3 - 6" pancakes (one of them was more like 5") in the pancake flight (sample of 3 different pancakes) is well over-priced. aspect: pancakes
All in all, I would return - as it was a beautiful restaurant - but I hope the staff pays more attention to the little details in the future. aspect: restaurant
This place is really trendi but they have forgotten about the most important part of a restaurant, the food. aspect: place
I've had the Jellyfish, Horse Mackerel, Blue Fin Tuna and the Sake Ikura roll among others, and they were all good. aspect: Blue Fin Tuna

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: sake
The atmosphere is noisy and the waiters are literally walking around doing things as fast as they can. aspect: waiters
They serve it in a tall, skinny hour-glass shaped glass to disguise the fact that you a getting a small juice at the price of a half gallon in a supermarket. aspect: juice
My father had the flank steak which was very good, and my mother had the swordfish. aspect: flank steak
The pancakes were certainly inventive but $8.50 for 3 - 6" pancakes (one of them was more like 5") in the pancake flight (sample of 3 different pancakes) is well over-priced. aspect: pancakes
Never have I had such dramatic delivery guys (a lot of huffing and panting and muttering under breath b/c I live in a walkup) who always seem disappointed with their tips. aspect: delivery guys

This guy refused to seat her and she left, followed shortly by the four of us, but not before I told him that in my 40 years of world travel, including Paris, that I had never seen such a display of bad behavior by a frontman in a restaurant. aspect: frontman
very nice servers, but they seemed more interested in conversing with the regulars than bringing food and being attentive. aspect: servers
The only dishes that were good were the chicken kebob (not hard to make) and the desserts, which were rice pudding. aspect: rice pudding
Sometimes tables don't understand his sense of humor but it's refreshing to have a server who has personality, professionalism, and respects the privacy of your dinner. aspect: server
The service was spectacular as the waiter knew everything about the menu and his recommendations were amazing! aspect: waiter

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: crab dumplings
the food was great, the margaritas too but the waitress was too busy being nice to her other larger party than to take better care of my friend and me. aspect: waitress
Although they do the typical what kind of water would you like questions the service was good and overall very relaxing to place to eat. aspect: place
Finally, my wife stood face to face in front of one of the staff and she asked, "Are you waiting for a table?" aspect: staff
Also, they upped their prices, so I have their old menu, and was surprised when my bill came to over $5 more than it used to (I know, not a huge deal). aspect: bill
The Food Regulars swear by the tamales, which are spongy, well-seasoned and pulled from steaming crocks on the counter. aspect: tamales
We both opted for a pasta dish and they were served timely and fresh. aspect: pasta dish
The service was non-existant, the manager spent all of his time at the bar. aspect: manager
I told the waiter that my drink tasted very bad and asked if he could swap it out for a Petron Margarita. aspect: drink
The food was all good but it was way too mild. aspect: food

Wasn't going to share but I feel obligated...while sitting at the sushi bar dining we watched the chef accidentally drop a piece of Unagi on the floor and upon retrieving it from the floor proceed to use the piece in the delivery order he was preparing. aspect: chef
Yes, the place is classy and beautiful, but they most certainly target the uber whealthy Not the common joe that wants to go all out every once in a while. aspect: place
got the guac but no drinks until it was all gone (approximately 20 minutes later). aspect: guac
The wait staff is very freindly, they make it feel like you're eating in a freindly little european town. aspect: wait staff
When the manager came to our table at the end of the meal and asked how our experience was, I complained to him about the cold. aspect: manager

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: banana tempura
The lobster sandwich is $24 and although it was good it was not nearly enough to warrant that price. aspect: lobster sandwich
I read reviews that called the restaurant too expensive and I thought to myself, but may be it is worth it. aspect: restaurant

The place was packed and while our food took time to be prepared, our waiter earned points for his sparkling conversation to pass time and for also knowing practically every ingredient of every special under consideration. aspect: waiter
My husband and I thougt it would be great to go to the Jekyll and Hyde Pub for our anniversary, and to our surprise it was fantastic. aspect: Jekyll and Hyde Pub
We initially ordered a bottle of wine and the waitress though we may not like it, so she offered us a taste. aspect: waitress
Food wise, its ok but a bit pricey for what you get considering the restaurant isn't a fancy place. aspect: restaurant

After dinner the manager grabbed my boyfriend, asked him: Where are you from...maybe you dont know how things work in America...and in the end stormed away almost teareyed yelling that tips are the only thing they survive on. aspect: manager
Both times I was extremely dissappointed by the service, which was boarderline rude. aspect: service
Went on a 3 day oyster binge, with Fish bringing up the closing, and I am so glad this was the place it O trip ended, because it was so great! aspect: Fish

When I asked the manager to remove the coffee, she did so without question, but never asked why and never followed up on the issue (she was far too busy flirting with the male waiters). aspect: manager
2 weeks ago, I decided to set up a birthday dinner in this establishment and was wary with the reviews I've read in City Search but it seems to be a perfect scene. aspect: scene
The service was impeccable and unobtrusive -- the staff knows what they are there to do -- to know their menu, present your meal, and attend to your needs. aspect: staff

I couple of weeks ago we went to Supper in the east village and it was so bad that we got up and left and the only way to save the evening of horrible food was to go to Blue Ribbon Bakery and have at least one thing off the menu. aspect: food
It isn't the cheapest sushi but has been worth it every time. aspect: sushi
The decor is night tho...but they REALLY need to clean that vent in the ceiling...its quite un-appetizing, and kills your effort to make this place look sleek and modern. aspect: place
Not including the tip for our server, who we saw twice in an hour? aspect: server
Small servings for main entree, i had salmon (wasnt impressed) girlfriend had chicken, it was good. aspect: chicken

When my dessert came, there was a candle in it - not because anyone asked for one - but because the waiter must have seen me opening my birthday card and gift, and said he knew it was a special occassion of some sort. aspect: waiter
I tend to judge a sushi restaurant by its sea urchin, which was heavenly at sushi rose. aspect: sea urchin
– This is my "must bring out of town guests to" restaurant and they always enjoy and rave about it. aspect: restaurant
Bernard is a great host; it didn't bother me a bit that he recited the entire menu to my wife. aspect: host
The appetizer came out cold and the waiter came and took it to the kitchen. aspect: appetizer
When I asked the waitress, she told me they couldn't afford the salmon, and had changed the dish (though not on the menu). aspect: waitress
The Food The classic Italian menu gets off to a good start with Queen's famous bread basket, which is loaded with a slew of crunchy, yeasty homemade varieties. aspect: bread
Our waiter never once asked how everything was, as I suspect he knew the kitchen was producing seriously average food. aspect: waiter
Winnie and her staff are the best crew you can find serving you. aspect: Winnie
We took advanatage of the half price sushi deal on saturday so it was well worth it. aspect: half price sushi deal
They have possibly the worst service in New York I have waited until the waiter has finished his paper, begged for water and waited over an hour for my meal. aspect: waiter

My girlfriend, being slightly more aggressive, and having been equally disgusted causing her to throw out the remainder of her barely eaten meal, called back only to be informed that I was probably wrong and that it was most likely an oyster, and that we were also blacklisted from their restaurant. aspect: meal
We were 4 and got the family size penne a la vodka which was tremendously gigantic portion...a bucket of food literally. aspect: penne a la vodka
I book a gorgeous white organza tent which included a four course prix fix menu which we enjoyed a lot. aspect: four course prix fix menu
I love the food here, and although it is pricey, the entree comes with rice, naan, dal, and salad, which makes it worthwhile. aspect: salad
Our waitress was very nice, not snotty - she even gave us a free apertif after the meal (and left the bottle on the table). aspect: waitress
The server was so busy the night we visited that she forgot to put in our food order. aspect: server
I like Cafe Noir dont get me wrong, it is jsut that the people who work there are evil and incompetent!! aspect: Cafe Noir
Worth visiting the 1st Ave spot because it is the original store. aspect: 1st Ave spot
The food looked very appetizing and delicious since it came on a variety of fancy plates. aspect: food

I don't remember the dessert item but when it was brought out flashing lights overhead threw colored beams on the walls and a young waiter came over to our table and did a little dance that was Bollywood MTV for the East Village set. aspect: dessert
I got the $10 10-piece dim sum combo, every bite of which was great. aspect: $10 10-piece dim sum combo
What do you like more, completely addictive patties of greasy beef, or glasses of cheap refreshing beer to wash it down? aspect: beef
The hostess was totally not accomadating, and even though there were empty tables they still didn't seat us! aspect: hostess

My ceasar salad amounted to some limp lettuce and mayo strewn around a large plate, and the only way I might have died for the mac and cheese is due to natural causes while waiting for it to arrive. aspect: mac and cheese
The space was so fantastic that once we heard they were serving dinner we decided to go one night and try it out. aspect: serving dinner
but when we looked at the menu, there weren't a lot of choices, most of them were dumplings in the appetizer section. aspect: menu
The quality of the sushi was bad, the way it was cut was bad, and the waiters kept trying to clear off my miso soup even when it wasn't finished. aspect: sushi
Kind of a small place but I guess if they are not too busy might be able to fit a group or kids. aspect: place
The waiter made a huge production over what order he should deliver the food, as we all agreed the miso should be eaten with the sushi to aid digestion. aspect: waiter
The scallops are apparently cooked in a black olive butter which really makes them unique (not to mention tasty). aspect: scallops
(I will say, the waitress was very sweet and did try to compensate for the chef and owner's poor beh- we gave her a big tip). aspect: waitress
Ive asked a cart attendant for a lotus leaf wrapped rice and she replied back rice and just walked away. aspect: cart attendant
He served me an Uni Hand roll, which I never had before, and let me tell you...IT WAS HEAVEN! aspect: Uni Hand roll
impressive balcony seating and while they forgot to give us the cold appetizers, the waiter and maitre'd more than made up for it by being most accomodating to us. aspect: maitre

If you’re planning to come here, make sure that your date is someone whom you really like since you’ll be ushered to private booths where there will be no people or food watching (choose the ones on the ground level that have glass ceilings so you may see the stars in the sky!). aspect: private booths
Server made several sake suggestions which were very good. aspect: sake
My boyfriend had Prime Rib it was good . aspect: Prime Rib
We had the lobster sandwich and it was FANTASTIC. aspect: lobster sandwich

What really makes it shine is the food, which is aggressively seasoned with Cyrpriot spices, and all made in-house (even the gyro meat and sausages), and made of much higher quality ingredients that might otherwise be expected. aspect: food
The wine list is incredible and extensive and diverse, the food is all incredible and the staff was all very nice, good at their jobs and cultured. aspect: staff
so about the prawns, they were fresh and had a slight crispiness about the batter... soooo good... the walnuts were cut in smaller pieces and very crunchy and tasty. aspect: prawns
Also, specify if you like your food spicy- its rather bland if you don't. aspect: food
when our server accidentally spilled some wine at our table, he cleaned it up offered us another glass right away. aspect: wine

The Four Seasons has history and it is a sort of landmark of New York City restaurants, but trust me, they will charge you through the nose just so that you can say "I've been to the four seasons restaurant". aspect: The Four Seasons
the fish was fresh, though it was cut very thin. aspect: fish

Each time we've been, the front of house staff (not the waiters - they're fantastic - but the people who greet and seat you) has been so hideous to us that were it not for the exceptional fish dishes I would never return. aspect: waiters
My son and his girlfriend both wanted cheeseburgers and they were huge! aspect: cheeseburgers
And it all comes at a very reasonable price (congee, noodles, and rice dishes are no more than $3-6 each). aspect: congee
The hostess and the waitress were incredibly rude and did everything they could to rush us out. aspect: hostess
The restaurant has a Family feel, not least with regard to the portions which are enormous; the veal alone could have single-handedly solved third world famine. aspect: portions
I have to highly recommend the lobster roll - not to much mayo; you can tell it was a fresh lobster. aspect: lobster roll

The hostess was condescending and the waiter was somewhat absent and unaccomodating (sure, we made a reservation to sit outside but when I asked to be moved indoors after I heard thunder he didn't even try to make it happen, giving me a blank stare and a shrug when I asked what we would do if it rained). aspect: waiter
The potato balls were not dry at all... in fact it was buttery. aspect: potato balls
It's a rather cramped and busy restaurant and it closes early. aspect: restaurant
I got the shellfish and shrimp appetizer and it was alright. aspect: shellfish and shrimp appetizer

So are cooked plates: Marinated Kobe beef practically melts on its skewers, soy-buttered scallops collapse with sweet brine and Chawanmushi custard, quivering in eel-soy broth with black truffles and foie gras, is over the top. aspect: Marinated Kobe beef
But if you're prepared to spend some $ and remember to ask if something they offer is complimentary, then this is the place to go for Indian food aspect: place
The food was good (and the $25 prix fixe made it all that much better), but the dinner started to feel like an assembly line when our appetizer arrived 5 minutes after ordering. aspect: food
I go there to eat dinner, brunch, or to just drink and hang out at the bar with the friendly staff. aspect: bar

I have it a 4 instead of 5 because of the price (just chicken tikka masala - no bread of rice - is $25), which I would expect at a upscale Indian restaurant but this place doesn't have an upscale feel. aspect: price
The waiter knew about every item on the menu and explained it very well. aspect: menu

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: sushi
It isn't the cheapest sushi but has been worth it every time. aspect: sushi
Management should really take notice and train their waitstaff and teach them some proper manners. aspect: waitstaff
I have been to Rao's probably 15 times the past 3 years and it keeps getting better. aspect: Rao's
I told the waiter that my drink tasted very bad and asked if he could swap it out for a Petron Margarita. aspect: waiter
it's a very chill spot to hang with a group, I went there with a bunch of my friends to have drinks for my birthday and we all had a great time. aspect: spot
Cool atmosphere, the fire place in the back really ads to it but needs a bit more heat throughout on a cold night. aspect: atmosphere
My party felt like we got put in a dining room for tourist, which must have been the penalty box area for the disgruntled wait staff on duty. aspect: dining room
Watch out for the overworked, stressed out waitress who dumps tapa dishes on the table and leaves w/out announcing what it is. aspect: waitress
I did not try the caviar but I tried their salmon and crab salad (they are all good) aspect: salmon
This place, which is only a few months old, is perhaps Queens' biggest secret! aspect: place
The presentation of the food was an added bonus, it looked just as great as it tasted! aspect: food
And it all comes at a very reasonable price (congee, noodles, and rice dishes are no more than $3-6 each). aspect: noodles

great meal – the fish on the omikase platter was absolutely decadent -- there was none of the stringiness that sometimes accompanies fair sushi -- this fish was perfect!!!! aspect: fish on the omikase platter
The food is decent at best, and the ambience, well, it's a matter of opinion, some may consider it to be a sweet thing, I thought it was just annoying. aspect: ambience
The manager claimed that he could not compensate us for anything on the bill which just shows the lack of sophistication from the entire group. aspect: manager
They have a wide variety of fish and they even list which oceans they come from; Atlantic or Pacific. aspect: fish

On Friday night the busboy was sulky verging on rude; he brought the fries (ordered for the entrees) twice before the appetizers came and then again the minute we'd finished them and looked put out to be asked to take the empty plates away. aspect: appetizers
Still, any quibbles about the bill were off-set by the pour-your-own measures of liquers which were courtesey of the house... aspect: measures of liquers
Myagi is one of my favorite restaurants in the City; the place the negative reviews describe sound like they were somewhere else. aspect: Myagi
I recently tried Suan and I thought that it was great. aspect: Suan
The only redeeming factor of the night was the dessert which was very good but certainly not worth the cost of an overall horible experience. aspect: dessert
Went here with my husband on a Saturday night for dinner since the place looked like it had great atmosphere. aspect: place
i got a steak special that was way overpriced ($12 more then the steak on the menu and no warning from the waitress) and it was cooked to the wrong temperature. aspect: steak special
Their bagels have the perfect softness to them, but on the outside there's a bit of crispiness to give it a bit of texture. aspect: bagels
Our waiter was a little stressed and brought a couple things out late and as a result, he apologized graciously and gave us wine on the house to compensate for the delay. aspect: waiter
No gimmicks here -- the food speaks for itself in its freshness and preparation. aspect: food
We asked for sides which the waiter than admitted that he forgot to put in that part of our order. aspect: waiter

The presentation of Snooze is excellent and it is one of those places that you feel more sophisticated just for being there; but peel back the layers and you have an overpriced IHOP with a high brow menu. aspect: Snooze

This much heralded restaurant brought my wife and I some excitement as we walked in the door, but we were met with an awkward maitre'd who barely spoke to us at all and just seemed standoff-ish. aspect: maitre
To their credit they removed the dish from the check; but no manager stopped by to ask what the problem was. aspect: manager
If you are going for the food, it will not be worth it. aspect: food
$6 and there is much tasty food, all of it fresh and continually refilled. aspect: food
If you don't mind pre-sliced low quality fish, unfriendly staff and a sushi chef that looks like he is miserable then this is your place. aspect: sushi chef
Had the calamari app, which TGIFriday's makes better, and the scallop ceviche - that is NOT ceviche! aspect: scallop ceviche

A hour passed until the waitress came over to give us menus and tell us she would be right back another hour later After trying to order fish she informed us that all fish entrees on the menu was sold out We took a minute to make a second choice and tried to order something else that we were told was also sold out. aspect: waitress
The food was mediocre at best but it was the horrible service that made me vow never to go back. aspect: service
Though it's been crowded most times I've gone here, Bark always delivers on their food. aspect: Bark
And it all comes at a very reasonable price (congee, noodles, and rice dishes are no more than $3-6 each). aspect: rice dishes
The busboys were more helpful than my server who then made me wait at the bar (very crowded with what appeared to be tasty margaritas) to pay the bartender - what's that about? aspect: server
Cute place, nice wait staff but would never go there again. aspect: place

The hostess was condescending and the waiter was somewhat absent and unaccomodating (sure, we made a reservation to sit outside but when I asked to be moved indoors after I heard thunder he didn't even try to make it happen, giving me a blank stare and a shrug when I asked what we would do if it rained). aspect: reservation
Had the calamari app, which TGIFriday's makes better, and the scallop ceviche - that is NOT ceviche! aspect: calamari app
when our server accidentally spilled some wine at our table, he cleaned it up offered us another glass right away. aspect: table
To be completely fair, the only redeeming factor was the food, which was above average, but couldn't make up for all the other deficiencies of Teodora. aspect: food
I had Lobster Bisque it has 2 oz. of Maine Lobster in it. aspect: Lobster Bisque
This is the first place I've been that a runner remembers my order... hope he likes his job because I have half a mind to steal him for my restaurant. aspect: runner

i think friends coffee shop makes great food the service is great and they are very poilte i think that they should open more because there the best food store i ever ate from the food is addicting and you cant stop eating because it so delious. aspect: service
Even the chickpeas, which I normally find too dry, were good. aspect: chickpeas
– My first time to dine at this restaurant was with my son and it was absolutely horrible! aspect: restaurant
I like Cafe Noir dont get me wrong, it is jsut that the people who work there are evil and incompetent!! aspect: people
The hostess was rude and I got a distinct feeling that they did not want to serve us. aspect: hostess
They have it all -- great price, food, and service. aspect: service
impressive balcony seating and while they forgot to give us the cold appetizers, the waiter and maitre'd more than made up for it by being most accomodating to us. aspect: waiter

I showed it to the manager, and he smilingly apologized and brought us two free desserts (but did not ask us what we wanted and so brought the last two desserts we would have asked for). aspect: manager
As it turns out the owner was seated right next to us and when he came over to check on our problems was very dismissive and offered a token 20% discount on our bill. aspect: owner
The manager finally said he would comp the two glasses of wine (which cost less than the food), and made it seem like a big concession. aspect: manager

– The sushi here is perfectly good, but for $5 a piece, either the slices of fish should be larger, or there should be no pretense that this is a moderately priced restaurant (even for NYC). aspect: restaurant
I had never had Edamame pureed before but I thought it was innovative and tasty (could've used a bit more salt). aspect: Edamame pureed
We had half/half pizza, mine was eggplant and my friend had the buffalo and it was sooo huge for a small size pizza! aspect: half/half pizza
My friend got the mushroom pizza which tasted better. aspect: mushroom pizza

I was told(very snottily) no, but then not even 10 minutes later another group of people came in, asked the same thing and because the same woman waiter knew them she gave them regular menus! aspect: waiter
We finally flagged down another server who brought us more to drink, and then they took forever with the check. aspect: server
The quality of the sushi was bad, the way it was cut was bad, and the waiters kept trying to clear off my miso soup even when it wasn't finished. aspect: miso soup
but the Server informed us that they wanted to make the soup their own and that she hopes we like it. aspect: soup
The decor is vibrant and eye-pleasing with several semi-private boths on the right side of the dining hall, which are great for a date. aspect: semi-private boths
then the manager gave us lemon juice instead of ceasar dressing for a ceasar salad which ruined the salad. aspect: lemon juice
When I called the waitress on it, she said that they simply couldn't serve tap water. aspect: waitress
When you're sitting in their main dining room (which has a spectacular, hand-painted high ceiling) you'd never know there was a world outside. aspect: main dining room

The defining characteristic of this popular restaurant, aside from dirt-cheap hot dogs, is the beverage selection, which includes a light and refreshing papaya juice, an extremely sweet pineapple juice and a sweet and frothy pina colada drink. aspect: beverage selection
To both our surprise, this inquiry was interpreted as a personal offense by the waiter who told my wife to leave the store if she didnt want the pastries. aspect: waiter
Don't judge this place prima facie, you have to try it to believe it, a home away from home for the literate heart. aspect: place
The atmosphere was pretty nice but had a bit lacking, which it tries to make up for with a crazy scheme of mirrors. aspect: atmosphere
The boths are not as small as some of the reviews make them out to look they're perfect for 2 people. aspect: boths
Asked for wine recommendations and the waitress told me her favorites and described them in detail - I don't encounter this much in NYC. aspect: waitress
I love Dungeness crabs and at Ray's you can get them served in about 6 different ways! aspect: Dungeness crabs
I went there for lunch and it was not as good as I expected from the reviews I read. aspect: lunch
Wait staff is blantently unappreciative of your business but its the best pie on the UWS! aspect: pie
The wife had the risotto which was amazing. aspect: risotto
My quesadilla tasted like it had been made by a three-year old with no sense of proportion or flavor. aspect: quesadilla
So inexpensive that you'd wonder about the sanity of the owners, if they weren't such good cooks. aspect: owners
Got the scoop on this new hot spot and decided to give it shot for a client dinner. aspect: spot
What do you like more, completely addictive patties of greasy beef, or glasses of cheap refreshing beer to wash it down? aspect: patties
The bill came out to like $100pp, and noone touched their food, and drinks were left untouched because after the first bite/sip you want to never touch it again. aspect: food
I was frankly shocked when I read the bad reviews - this place is fantastic; it has not let us down in any way, and we've eaten here more than 10 times. aspect: place
I ordered the fried catfish, which had very little to no seasoning, the yams, and mac and cheese which were just okay. aspect: mac and cheese

For desserts, we tried the frozen black sesame mousse (interesting but not extraordinary) and matcha (powdered green tea) and blueberry cheesecake, which was phenomenal. aspect: matcha (powdered green tea) and blueberry cheesecake
This tiny restaurant is as cozy as it gets, with that certain Parisian flair. aspect: restaurant
Especially the manager or host who kept walking by and giving us the evil eye to see the progress of our dinner so they could turn the table over to other customers. aspect: host
Sunday afternoons there is a band playing and it is lots of fun. aspect: band
I complained to the manager, but he was not even apologetic. aspect: manager

Over the years the host, Vittorio, and his crew, have always treated me as family--although with all the business this not-so-little gem does, it amazing he's even able to remember a consistent but not-so-frequent visitor. aspect: Vittorio
After our meal,the manager, even took some of his time to sit with us and give us a lesson in Sake 101. aspect: manager
I thanked my friend who recommended me this restaurant and will certainly recommend it to others. aspect: restaurant
I've been to at Cafe Spice probably 5-8 times, it is probably still the best Indian restaurant around Union Square. aspect: Cafe Spice

The music playing was very hip, 20-30 something pop music, but the subwoofer to the sound system was located under my seat, which became annoying midway through dinner. aspect: subwoofer to the sound system
I love the food here, and although it is pricey, the entree comes with rice, naan, dal, and salad, which makes it worthwhile. aspect: naan
One would think we'd get an apology or complimentary drinks - instead, we got a snobby waiter wouldn't even take our order for 15 minutes and gave us lip when we asked him to do so. aspect: waiter
I ordered the fried catfish, which had very little to no seasoning, the yams, and mac and cheese which were just okay. aspect: fried catfish
I started out with a Bombay beer which was big enough for two. aspect: Bombay beer
When I lived upstate for a while I would buy freeze the bagels and they would still be better than any else. aspect: bagels

We are very particular about sushi and were both please with every choice which included: ceviche mix (special), crab dumplings, assorted sashimi, sushi and rolls, two types of sake, and the banana tempura. aspect: ceviche mix (special)
The sushi is as fresh as it comes?you'd think ocean was in their backyard, no joke! aspect: sushi
I rejected it because in the process of attempting to fix the eggs they broke something else in the dish and I was too frustrated to continue. aspect: dish

dinner on 1st floor (street level) a bit noisy, 2nd floor has bed-style seating that is good for dessert drinks (do not attempt to have entree on the bed, what a mess it will be trying to eat rice dishes with sauce while half-lying down). aspect: dinner
La Rosa waltzes in, and I think they are doing it the best. aspect: La Rosa
This is where it really really gets bad: the manager said, there is absolutely nothing we can do, it's a matter of taste that she didn't like it, and I cannot comp it. aspect: manager
Food was amazing - I love Indian food and eat it quite regularly, but I can say this is one of the best I've had. aspect: Food
I had their eggs benedict for brunch, which were the worst in my entire life, I tried removing the hollondaise sauce completely that was how failed it was. aspect: eggs benedict

We were directed to a table by a member of staff, which we were then informed was reserved, and lost our seats at the bar, all this after spending upwards of $30 each on very expensive drinks over a two-hour period. aspect: table
You must have the crabmeat lasagna which is out of this world and the chocolate bread pudding for dessert. aspect: crabmeat lasagna
I love the food here, and although it is pricey, the entree comes with rice, naan, dal, and salad, which makes it worthwhile. aspect: food
Tiny dessert was $8.00...just plain overpriced for what it is. aspect: dessert
The bill came out to like $100pp, and noone touched their food, and drinks were left untouched because after the first bite/sip you want to never touch it again. aspect: drinks
After being ignored by our waiter we complained to the manager who assured us everything would improve. aspect: manager
but the Server informed us that they wanted to make the soup their own and that she hopes we like it. aspect: Server
Service was just ok, it is not what you'd expect for $500. aspect: Service
We were however seated right away and was immediately told by our waiter that they were out of sparking mineral water. aspect: waiter
the only things u could really taste are the very salty soy sauce (even its low sodium), the vinegar-soaked rice, and the scallion on top of the fish. aspect: soy sauce
